item.title: For programmers who are interested in #Golang and/or #bots , you may checkout https://github.com/deltachat-bot/deltabot-cli-go -- The new statically linked deltachat-rpc-server can run on 32/64 bit and be used from any programming language by calling async RPC requests via stdin/stdout to a deltachat-rpc-server running in a subprocess. As released Desktop uses this jsonrpc-API it's also pretty complete.

And then, some devs are now hell-bound to port the complete Delta Chat Core from #Rust to #Python for the next release https://github.com/deltachat/deltachat-core-rust/pull/4259 (already works and passes the tests locally but CI is failing -- go figure!)

We hardly talked about #security audits but there is nothing to hide! #DeltaChat received three security audits in total, covering core networking #encryption as well as SMTP/IMAP protocol and end-to-end encryption, and also including an audit on our recent secure server setup guide: https://delta.chat/en/2023-03-27-third-independent-security-audit

A little chatgpt-bot for Delta https://github.com/deltachat-bot/chatbot -- you need to instantiate it yourselves on some e-mail address but then it's very easy to use e.g. for your family or partners via regular Delta Chat chatting. Btw please be warned: we likely will quickly ban accounts who post AI-generated posts to our support forum. If you are curious ask your favorite chat-bot for an argument why posting machine-generated content to a user support forum is unethical ;)

thanks to @adbenitez (maintainer of that mastodon bot) for pointing out that OAUTH2 is available too -- so no need to provide your password to the bot. Of course it still sees you interacting which still requires some trust to be put into the operator of the bot.

This @delta account is mediated in a chat group where anyone in the group can reply and see interactions, or follow the "home" chat with posts from the accounts we follow. For implementation see https://github.com/simplebot-org/simplebot_mastodon (also on PyPI) -- the bot needs your credentials so it's best to run this bot in an environment you trust.

If you are curious or interested about bot development then the echo bot repository has example impls in Python, Rust, Javascript/Typescript and even C (but better to use Rust these days ;) https://github.com/deltachat-bot/echo -- and thanks to @adbenitez there are also many more advanced chat bots written as "simplebot" plugins here https://github.com/simplebot-org

Wouldn't it be nice if you could migrate with Delta Chat from one e-mail provider to another and keep all your chats and communications and encryption working seamlessly? A little tech preview for Delta Chat iOS to easily setup a second device, under the hood using the fast evolving Rust implementation of @IPFS@twitter.com https://github.com/n0-computer/iroh/ -- not the only use we are envisioning of this interesting P2P effort ;)

Some days ago we visited the fine folks behind https://mailcow.email and https://servercow.de -- while mailcow installations already work well with Delta Chat we want to increase speed of message delivery, spam processing and aim for easier onboarding with mailcow installs.
